KIK is used to set varying levels of authorized access by means of color-coded keys; yellow, grey and red; for operators, facility managers and technicians, respectively.  Facility managers can set parameters such as travel speed, brush speed, motor output or cleaning solution output to suit the needs of the cleaning task. An operator’s key carries out the pre-determined settings, needing only to select their desired cleaning program from a rotary knob. As a result, only the required amount of energy and cleaning agent is used.

When leaving the driver's seat, which is fitted with a seat contact mat, or switching off the motor, the main sweeper roller and the side brushes are lifted automatically.
